docs.text: WITNESS4Climate website is supported by WITNESS4Climate foundation, a French "Association d'intérêt général à but non lucratif"
docs.title: About

docs.text: You can choose to install simply sostrades core, which will enable you to run studies with a minimum infrastructure setup but with no cloud, access rights, traceability or interactive GUI (scripts are available to generate plots) Another option is to install the full platform, for which you will need to setup a cloud infrastructure to run Docker and Kubernetes, setup a MySQL database, and a keycloak server. Basic install Setting up your environment Check or install basic development blocs are there sudo apt-get install -y make build-essential libssl-dev zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libreadline-dev libsqlite3-dev wget curl llvm libncurses5-dev libncursesw5-dev xz-utils tk-dev libffi-dev liblzma-dev python-openssl Install pyenv . The guidelines below are from RealPython article curl https://pyenv.run | bash Install Python3.9 using pyenv pyenv install 3.9.21 Install Python virtual environment and activate it (if you need to deactivate it later, you can just type deactivate , which is an alias that the activate script will have created) python -m venv <venv directory> source <venv directory>/bin/activate Clone sostrades-core and install on your local system clone sostrades-core to your local disk git clone https://github.com/os-climate/sostrades-core.git install needed requirements pip install -r sostrades-core/requirements.in run the setup cd sostrades-core; python setup.py install python setup.py install test: python bla bla
docs.title: Basic

docs.text: Check or install basic development blocs are there sudo apt-get install -y make build-essential libssl-dev zlib1g-dev libbz2-dev libreadline-dev libsqlite3-dev wget curl llvm libncurses5-dev libncursesw5-dev xz-utils tk-dev libffi-dev liblzma-dev python-openssl Install pyenv . The guidelines below are from RealPython article curl https://pyenv.run | bash Install Python3.9 using pyenv pyenv install 3.9.21 Install Python virtual environment and activate it (if you need to deactivate it later, you can just type deactivate , which is an alias that the activate script will have created) python -m venv <venv directory> source <venv directory>/bin/activate
docs.title: Setting up your environment

docs.text: clone sostrades-core to your local disk git clone https://github.com/os-climate/sostrades-core.git install needed requirements pip install -r sostrades-core/requirements.in run the setup cd sostrades-core; python setup.py install python setup.py install test: python bla bla
docs.title: Clone sostrades-core and install on your local system

docs.text: You can choose to install simply sostrades core, which will enable you to run studies with a minimum infrastructure setup but with no cloud, access rights, traceability or GUI (scripts are available to generate plots) Another option is to install the full platform, which will need to setup a cloud infrastructure to run Docker and Kubernetes, setup a MySQL database, and a keycloak server. Full sostrades platform install see here
docs.title: Platform
